intro: Tithymalus obtusifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaved tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its rounded, broad leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in umbels. Native to southern Europe and parts of Asia, this plant thrives in dry, rocky habitats. It is often found in open woodlands and along rocky slopes. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
